intro: Astracantha hasbeyana, commonly known as the Persian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Astracantha hasbeyana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
